title: Fresh off the Super Bowl halftime show, Lady Gaga will perform at Fenway Park
text:
On the heels of her aerial trick- and drone-filled Super Bowl halftime show , Lady Gaga has announced that sheâ€™ll play Fenway Park this fall. Sheâ€™ll make the stop on Sept. 1 during her Joanne World Tour .
You saw what Lady Gaga can do last night, and now she's bringing her show to Fenway this Sept!
ðŸŽŸ on sale 2/13: https://t.co/wdBU2n1Ndt pic.twitter.com/vsNmPJ0Edr

Gaga released Joanne , her fifth studio album, in October, and it debuted at No. 1 on the Billboard Top 200.
The Grammy- and Golden Globe-winning singer will kick off her tour on Aug. 1 in Vancouver and play 16 shows across North America before traveling to Rio de Janeiro to play the Rock in Rio Festival on Sept. 15. Sheâ€™ll then perform across Europe before heading back to North America in November and December for another 17 shows.
Tickets for the first leg of Gagaâ€™s North American performances, which includes the Fenway Park show, go on sale Feb. 13 at 10 a.m.
